articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The fighting between Israel and Hamas, which launched a surprise attack on Saturday, is the latest in seven decades of war and conflict between Israelis and Palestinians that has drawn in outside powers and destabilised the wider Middle East.
articles.title: What's the Israel-Palestinian conflict about? The origin of wars explained

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Tuesday denounced Hamas and stressed U.S. support for Israel as it mourns the killing of more than 1,000 people, including at least 14 Americans, from a surprise attack launched by the Palestinian militant group.
articles.title: 'An act of sheer evil': Biden pledges support for Israel, American Jews in speech

articles.author: Daniel Trotta
articles.description: Prominent Harvard University alumni on Monday denounced a pro-Palestinian statement from students that blamed Israel for violence engulfing the region and urged the university to take action against the signatories.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian letter from Harvard students provokes alumni outrage

articles.author: Jonathan Saul, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's military has rallied after an initial chaotic scramble to halt an assault by Palestinian Islamist group Hamas and is retaliating with airstrikes on roads, buildings and other sites in Gaza while sending huge reinforcements towards the enclave.
articles.title: After Hamas attack, Israeli retaliation tactics raise Gaza invasion fears

articles.author: Steven Scheer
articles.description: The spiralling conflict with the Palestinians is set to derail a fragile recovery in Israel's all-important tech sector, say investors and analysts, after a global slowdown and the government's divisive judicial reforms saw funding drop sharply this year.
articles.title: Analysis: War with Hamas threatens funding recovery in Israel's vital tech industry

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel has frozen cryptocurrency accounts used to solicit donations for the Palestinian militant group Hamas on social media, police said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel freezes crypto accounts seeking Hamas donations, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tehran was not involved in the militant Hamas group's weekend attack on Israel, Iran's top authority Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Tuesday, but hailed what he called Israel's "irreparable" military and intelligence defeat.
articles.title: Iran's Khamenei says Tehran was not behind Hamas attack on Israel

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Bodies of Israeli residents and Hamas militants lay out in the grounds of the Kfar Aza kibbutz among burned out houses, strewn furniture and torched cars, as Israeli soldiers went from house to house to take away the dead.
articles.title: Bodies of residents and militants lie in the grounds of ravaged Israeli kibbutz

articles.author: Emily Rose, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Islamist militant Hamas movement threatened to execute an Israeli captive every time Israel bombs a Palestinian home without warning, as Israel called up an unprecedented 300,000 reservists and imposed a blockade on the Gaza Strip, raising fears it planned a ground assault.
articles.title: Hamas threatens to kill captives if Israel strikes civilians

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A subsea gas pipeline and a telecommunications cable connecting Finland and Estonia have both sustained damage, and the location of the outage has been identified, the Finnish government said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Finland says "outside activity" likely damaged gas pipeline, telecoms cable
